benchmark_details.name: FED (Fast and Efficient Dataset Deduplication Framework)
benchmark_details.overview: FED is a GPU-accelerated deduplication framework optimized for MinHash LSH, significantly enhancing data quality and training performance of large language models by efficiently removing duplicate entries in large datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an efficient and scalable solution for dataset deduplication that enhances data quality for training large language models.

data.source: Generated from large-scale document datasets, including RealNews and C4.
data.annotation: Identifying and removing duplicate entries based on Jaccard similarity thresholds.

methodology.calculation: Calculated using pairwise comparisons of document signatures based on Jaccard similarity.
methodology.interpretation: A higher Jaccard similarity score indicates better performance in identifying and removing duplicates.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison against CPU and GPU baseline methods shows significant speedup and accuracy in deduplication.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using large-scale experiments on benchmark datasets.
